results.title: Fire's on - Lapstone tunnel by Arthur Streeton, 1891
results.creator_credit: Art Gallery of New South Wales, David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Australian eye I”.
The death of a workman during blasting of the railway tunnel at Lapstone in the NSW Blue Mountains in 1891 was Arthur Streeton’s inspiration for this painting. Streeton’s vivid description of the accident in a letter to his artist friend Tom Roberts is included in the commentary. Written by David Muir and edited by Ian Walker.

results.title: Rhythmic composition in yellow green minor
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye I”.
A study of the painting “Rhythmic Composition in Yellow Green Minor” (1919) by Roy de Maistre (1894-1968). Also discusses the artist’s theories linking music to painting and his belief in harmony in life and art. One of the first abstract paintings produced in Australia - far advanced for its time. De Maistre also developed and patented a colour wheel.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: Portrait of Dame Mary Gilmore
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Film Australia and Art Gallery of New South Wales
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye I”.
The film is built around recording of the voices of William Dobell, Dame Mary Gilmore, and James Gleeson. It evokes very strongly and personally the way in which a portrait painter approaches his subject.

results.title: Launceston
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Peter Young, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Aspects of life in Launceston. Industries include Paton and Baldwins woollen mills, Repco ball bearing factory, timber mills and furniture manufacturers. Shows schools, the general hospital, churches, and the historic home of Entally built in 1820. Motor racing at Longford, bicycyle racing, water skiing and archery are popular forms of recreation. Theatres, restaurants and night clubs, provide a variety of evening entertainment.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Edwards, Peter Young, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board

results.title: Wagga Wagga
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”
Shows family life and the rural, industrial and commercial interests of the city of Wagga Wagga, NSW. Also covers sporting, cultural and recreational activities.

results.title: Sydney: The School of the forties 1941-1981
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
Man Feeding His Dogs (9min): A look at artist Russell Drysdale and his work. Madame Sosostris (10min): A joint product by artist James Gleeson and sculptor Robert Klippel is examined. Portrait of Dame Mary Gilmore (9min): An insight into one of Australia’s most controversial paintings. Sydney, 1942 (10min): A look at the work of Sali Herman.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia

results.title: The Australian impressionists 1888-1896
results.creator_credit: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
A look at paintings by Australian impressionists - A Holiday at Mentone: Charles Conder (1888). The Breakaway: Tom Roberts (1890-91). Fire’s On, Lapstone Tunnel: Arthur Streeton (1891). Moonrise, Templestowe: David Davies (1894). On the Wallaby Track: Frederick McCubbin (1896).
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Muir, Malcolm Otton and Film Australia
results.description:
Episode of Series “The Australian eye”.
